title.rendered: The Importance of Regular Water Heater Maintenance

content.rendered:
Your water heater works hard every day to provide you with hot water, but it often gets overlooked—until something goes wrong! Regular maintenance is key to extending the life of your water heater and ensuring it operates efficiently. Start by checking the temperature setting, which should be around 120°F for optimal performance. It’s also important to flush the tank annually to remove sediment build-up, which can lead to corrosion and reduce efficiency. Lastly, inspect the anode rod every few years, as it helps prevent rust inside the tank. Taking these steps can save you from costly repairs and keep your water heater running smoothly for years to come.
